items.title: NTPC Green Energy IPO offers a valuable lesson for PSUs in value creation
items.description: The IPO values NTPC Green Energy at Rs 91,000 crore to 1 lakh crore, generating value for NTPC investors and setting the to-be-listed company on an independent path

items.title: Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals Q2: Robust growth in spite of challenges
items.description: Focus on premium product portfolio amid festive season and the revival in lighting will be key growth drivers

items.title: Doms Industries: Impressive Q2, sound growth strategy
items.description: The stationery supplier is charting expansion via both organic and inorganic routes

items.title: Reverse-Flipping: Indian startups return ‘home’ amid regulatory reforms
items.description: Indian startups are increasingly reversing their corporate structures, returning from overseas hubs due to regulatory changes, tax incentives, and favorable IPO valuations. The September 2024 amendment streamlines cross-border mergers, accelerating the reverse-flipping trend

items.title: VIP Industries: Is the near-term pain getting priced in?
items.description: Can investors bet on a probable turnaround in VIP?

items.title: Honasa Consumer: Should you be catching this falling knife?
items.description: The company is in for a long winter as revised business strategy may impact growth

items.title: Waaree Energies Q2FY25 profit jumps 15% to Rs 362 crore, to invest Rs 600 crore in subsidiaries
items.description: The board also discussed entering the manufacturing of electrolyser for green hydrogen
